Dear Ryan Griffus:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Resident restraint
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10177
Section Rule 177. (1) The facility shall establish and follow written policy
Description and procedures specifying the use of resident restraint.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/17/24, youth attempted to sneak to use the phone and was
caught by staff. Youth was restrained. Youth sustained a gash on
the outside of his right eye. Youth was taken for medical
treatment.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 06/25/2024 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
Foster Care Worker was notified on 06/25/2024 via email of the
incident.
Supervisor was interviewed on 06/25/2024 at the facility, in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor has been working
at the facility for 28 years. Supervisor completed Crisis Prevention
Institute (CPI) refresher training last month and is trained in doing
restraints. Supervisor reported there were two incidents involving
Youth A on 06/17/2024 and on 06/24/2024, in both incidents
Youth A refused to go to his room at bedtime. On 06/17/2024,
Youth A had attempted to use the telephone, Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempted to verbally redirect Youth A, and that’s when Youth A
tried wrapping the telephone cord around his neck, but staff
grabbed the cord from Youth’s A hand. Supervisor came on the
unit to assist Staff 1 and Staff 2 to escort Youth A to his room. She
was assisting the two staff members when Youth A tripped her
and she, the two staff members, and Youth A fell forward on the
floor. Youth A sustained a rug burn on the right side of his face
due to falling forward. She and the two staff members restrained
Youth A on the floor until he calmed down. Youth A was placed in
the suicide room outside the control room, so that he could be
monitored by staff for 24 hours. Youth A was provided with first
aide for the rug burn and was examined by the Nurse on
06/19/2024. On 06/24/2024 Youth A went to his room for the
night, but when Staff 3 walked off the unit, Youth A came out of
2

his room. She said Youth A must have held the doorknob, so his
door didn’t lock. This was the first time that Youth A got out of his
room after the doors were locked. She said the control room has a
computer monitor that lets them know when the bedroom doors
are locked, so she is not sure why the monitor showed all the
doors locked but Youth A was able to open the door. Staff 2 and
Staff 3 tried to get Youth A to go back to his room, but he wouldn’t
so she allowed Youth A to use the telephone. Youth A called
Centralized Intake. She allowed Youth A to use the telephone
thinking that would calm him down, but after the call Youth A
refused to go to his room and grabbed the television cord. She
and Staff 2 attempted to verbally de-escalate but Youth A refused
to hand over the cords. She and Staff 2 attempted a standing
restraint to escort Youth A to his room, but Youth A started to fight
them by biting and kicking them, so they all fell on the floor. Youth
A was again restrained on the floor by Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff 2
and Staff 3 until he calmed down. Youth A is currently being
monitored closely by staff due to the second incident and the
therapist has been meeting with Youth A. Supervisor denied
Youth A had a difficult time breathing or was in any distress while
being restrained.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 06/25/2024, in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A reported he is
currently on restrictions due to running out of his room and using
the telephone. Youth A was observed to have rug burn (scabbing)
the size of a quarter below his right eye, and similar size rug burn
on his right wrist. He said the bruise on his eye is from being
restrained on 06/19/2024 and the one on his wrist is from being
restrained on 06/24/2024. Youth A feels he should not be at the
facility. He does not like the facility or the staff. He said the staff
are too much but would not provide any specific details. Youth A
reported on 06/19/2024 he was attempting to call the suicide
hotline, but staff would not let him. He said Supervisor and Staff 1
slammed him on the floor and restrained him on the floor resulting
in him getting the rug burn on his face. Youth A said he was given
an ice pack and saw the nurse for the rug burn on his face. Youth
A said he was put in the observation room and was being
monitored by staff. Youth A admitted he used the telephone
yesterday and called Children’s Protective Services (CPS) to
report the rug burn on his face. Youth A reported he was
restrained on the floor resulting in him getting the bruise on his
wrist. Youth A said Supervisor was holding his shoulders down
and Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were holding his arms and legs.
He said he was fighting while being restrained and that’s how he
got the rug burns on his wrists. Youth A said he told staff he could
3

not breathe, but he said the staff didn’t care. Youth A admitted to
always trying to use the phone, because staff only allow him to
call his Foster Care Worker, but he wants to be able to make other
phone calls. Youth A admitted he tricked staff by holding the
doorknob, so his bedroom door didn’t lock and that’s how he was
able to get out of his bedroom. Youth A again said he does not
like being at the facility and wanted to know if he can be moved.
Youth A was told to talk to his Foster Care Worker about his
placement.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 06/25/2024, in conjunction with
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported on 06/17/2024 Youth A didn’t
want to go to his room at bedtime. She cleared the unit and had all
the youths go to their bedrooms. Youth A was pacing and
grabbing things, so she and Staff 2 put Youth A in a standing
restraint attempting to escort him to his room. Supervisor came on
the unit and took over for Staff 1, and that’s when Youth A tripped
Supervisor, and they all fell forward on the floor. Youth A started
kicking and trying to bite the staff, so Youth A was restrained on
the floor. She believes the scab below his eye was a result of
Youth A rubbing his face against the floor while being restrained.
She said once Youth A calmed down, he was escorted to his room
and put on observation for 24 hours. She said Youth A was
provided with ice for his face, and antibiotic cream for the scab.
Staff 1 said on 06/24/2024, Youth A again was trying to use the
telephone, so Supervisor allowed Youth A to use the telephone.
Afterwards Youth A was refusing to go to his room. Youth A ripped
the phone off the wall, so she, Staff 2, and Supervisor tried to
verbally deescalate Youth A. Youth A finally handed them the
phone cord, but then he grabbed the x-box controller and removed
the battery. Staff continued to verbally try to get Youth A to hand
over the battery. Youth A finally handed the staff the battery, but
then he grabbed the television cords. Youth A was not complying
with staff, so he was put in a standing restraint, but Youth A made
his body “dead weight” and they all fell to the floor. Youth A was
restrained on the floor, because Youth A started to kick, and spit
on staff. She and Staff 2 were holding Youth A’s wrist and
Supervisor was holding Youth A’s shoulders. Youth A did attempt
to spit on Supervisor while being restrained on the floor. Staff 1
said Youth A did say he could not breathe, and she did not believe
that they were putting a lot of pressure on him. Once Youth A
calmed down, he was escorted to his room and monitored for the
rest of the night. Youth A was provided with antibiotic cream for
the rug burns. Staff 1 reported she is trained in CPI and
completed the refresher training two weeks ago.
4

Staff 2 was interviewed on 06/25/2024, in conjunction with
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 recalled the incident on 06/17/2024
and reported he and Staff 1 were trying to escort Youth A back to
his room, but he was resistant. Supervisor came on the unit and
tried to assist, Youth A leaned forward and tripped them, so they
all fell to the floor. Youth A was kicking, spitting, and trying to bite
them, so Youth A was restrained on the floor. Staff 2 said Youth
A’s face scab was caused by Youth A falling forward and hitting
his face against the floor. Youth A was provided with ice and
antibiotic cream for his face.
Staff 3 was not involved in the first restraint and therefore she was
not interviewed.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 06/25/2024, in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. Therapist reported she meets
with Youth A weekly. Youth A is diagnosed with Disruptive Mood
Dysregulation Disorder. She denied Youth A reported feeling
suicidal or having thoughts about self-harming. She met with
Youth A on 06/24/2024, he reported feeling depressed, but denied
feeling suicidal or having a plan. Therapist reviews all incidents
and during every session Therapist discusses Youth A’s feelings,
thoughts, and actions in reference to the incidents. She will
continue to meet and monitor Youth A closely.
Director was interviewed on 06/25/2024, in conjunction with
MDHHS Specialist. Director reported Youth A seems to always act
up around bedtime. Director said all staff are trained in CPI and he
debriefed with the Supervisor regarding Youth A being restrained.
Youth A was provided first aide for the rug burn and was
examined by the nurse. Director reported Youth A is currently
being monitored due to self-harming and has been seen by the
therapist. Director was informed that Youth A reported he was
able to hold the doorknob and prevent his bedroom door from
locking. Director said he is not aware of any incidents or concerns
regarding the bedroom doors not locking. Director is going to have
maintenance check all doors to ensure there are no issues with
the locks.
Youth B was interviewed on 07/02/2024 via telephone in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist who was at the facility. Youth
B recalled Youth A being restrained on 06/17/2024. Youth B was
in her room, looked under her door, and saw Youth A being
restrained on the floor. She saw staff holding his arms and legs.
She could not identify staff members that were restraining the
5

youth. Youth B said she heard Youth A say he could not breath
while being restrained.
Youth C was interviewed on 07/02/2024 via telephone in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist who was at the facility. Youth
B has been at the facility for four months. Youth B recalled an
incident involving Youth A being restrained. She was in her room,
but she was able to see from under her door. Youth A was trying
to use the telephone. She saw Youth A punch staff and hurt
himself. She witnessed Youth A being restrained on the floor and
staff were holding his back down and she heard Youth A say, “I
can’t breathe, get off me bitch.” She saw Supervisor holding Youth
A’s arms, Staff 2 holding Youth A’s back, and Staff 1 holding
Youth A legs. Youth A was spitting and kicking the staff. She
heard staff telling Youth A to calm down.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage from 06/17/2024 was reviewed on 06/25/2024
(note: there is no audio). At approximately 8:30pm, Youth A is
observed walking towards the back wall of the unit, Youth A
grabbed the telephone and Staff 1 took the telephone away. Staff
1 appeared to be talking to Youth A, but Youth A is not
acknowledging Staff 1. Supervisor walked in as Staff 1 and Staff
2 were trying to engage with Youth A. Staff 1 and Staff 2 held
Youth A's hands and were moving him away from the back
counter, but Youth A had pushed and resisted. At 8:35pm,
Supervisor took over for Staff 1 and that’s when Youth A pushed
his body forward, put his feet in front of Supervisor and they all fell
forward on the floor. Youth A’s right side of his face hit the floor.
Youth A appeared to be kicking and moving all his limbs. Youth A
was restrained on the floor until 8:43pm. Youth A’s face was not
observed to be obstructed during the restraint.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 06/17/2024, written by Staff 1 is
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Incident report dated 06/24/2024, written by Supervisor is
consistent with Supervisor’s interview.
• Youth A’s Risk Checklist dated 06/17/2024 thru
06/19/2024.
• Medical treatment form for Youth A dated 06/19/2024. Rug
rash from intervention. Area below right eye scabbed, use
triple antibiotic cream twice a day.
• Detention Policy Section 3-emergency and safety- Physical
Restraints: Physical restraints should never be used as a
punishment. Staff should use physical restraint in
6

instances where the youth pose a safety risk to themselves
or others, instances of property damage or in cases where
a youth refuses to traffic to their room at the request of the
staff. Staff should use their safe physical management
techniques in the physical restraint and transport of a
resident.
• Detention Policy-resident illness: In instances in which a
resident states that he or she is too ill to participate in
program activities, the following procedures and
precautions should be followed: the youth will be removed
from the general population and restricted to their rooms.
Necessary medical treatment should be dispensed and
documented. The youth should be continuously monitored
via the auditory system any time they are in their rooms.
• CPI training guide: Safety interventions holding skills. Staff
are trained to perform the following holds:
1. Seated: low-level restriction
2. Seated: Medium level restriction
3. Seated: High level restriction
4. Standing: Low level restriction
5. Standing: Medium level restriction
6. Standing: High level restriction
• There is no mention of utilizing a floor restraint in the
training guide or restraint policies.
• Personnel records for Supervisor, Staff 1, and Staff 2- No
disciplinary actions noted.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage, and
documentation reviewed, there is a violation in reference to staff
performing a floor restraint, which is outside of the facility restraint
policy and CPI training guide. It cannot be determined if Youth A’s
injury was a result of falling on the floor or from being restrained.
Technical Assistance was provided regarding staff checking to
ensure the bedroom doors are locked after youths go to their
rooms at night.
Conclusion Violation Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
